title: Samsung publishes a longer list of Galaxy devices eligible for the One UI 7 update,  it goes back to 2021
description: We have an update on the One UI 7 rollout and it’s good news this time – the press release from Samsung Singapore lists more devices that will be updated to the latest Samsung software. So far, we knew about the newer models: Galaxy S24 and S23 series, Z Fold6 and Z Fold5, Z Flip6 and Z Flip5, along with the Galaxy Tab S10 and Tab S9. But the list actually extends back to 2021 models. Here are some of the Galaxy devices that will be updated to One UI 7, but note that this isn’t the complete list (more on that in a minute). Galaxy S phones Galaxy S24, S24+ and S24 Ultra ...
excerpt: This still isn't the full list, though. We have an update on the One UI 7 rollout and it’s good news this time – the press release from Samsung Singapore...
text: We have an update on the One UI 7 rollout and it’s good news this time – the press release from Samsung Singapore lists more devices that will be updated to the latest Samsung software. So far, we knew about the newer models: Galaxy S24 and S23 series, Z Fold6 and Z Fold5, Z Flip6 and Z Flip5, along with the Galaxy Tab S10 and Tab S9. But the list actually extends back to 2021 models. Here are some of the Galaxy devices that will be updated to One UI 7, but note that this isn’t the complete list (more on that in a minute). Galaxy S phones Galaxy S24, S24+ and S24 Ultra Galaxy S24 FE Galaxy S23, S23+ and S23 Ultra Galaxy S23 FE Galaxy S22, S22+ and S22 Ultra Galaxy S21, S21+ and S21 Ultra Galaxy S21 FE Galaxy Z foldables Galaxy Z Fold6 and Z Flip6 Galaxy Z Fold5 and Z Flip5 Galaxy Z Fold4 and Z Flip4 Galaxy Z Fold3 and Z Flip3 Galaxy Tab slates Galaxy Tab S10+ and Tab S10 Ultra Galaxy Tab S9, Tab S9+ and Tab S9 Ultra Galaxy Tab S9 FE and Tab S9 FE+ Galaxy Tab S8, Tab S8+ and Tab S8 Ultra Galaxy Tab S6 Lite (2024) and Tab S6 Lite (2022) Note that we’re not 100% sure on the Galaxy Tab S6 Lite as the press release doesn’t specify the year – the 2024 is a shoo-in, while the 2022 model is a “maybe” for now. The original Tab S6 Lite from 2020 ended its update cycle with Android 13. Also, there should be a gaggle of Galaxy A phones that will be getting One UI 7, that is how we know the list isn’t complete yet, but we don’t dare to think how long it would take Samsung to get to those. Speaking of timing, the press release says nothing on when these devices will be updated. Rollout for the newer models will start on April 7 in some regions, April 10 in others and, as it turns out, April 14 in other regions still – that is the date given in the Singapore press release. Source
html:
We have an update on the One UI 7 rollout and it’s good news this time – the press release from Samsung Singapore lists more devices that will be updated to the latest Samsung software.

So far, we knew about the newer models: Galaxy S24 and S23 series, Z Fold6 and Z Fold5, Z Flip6 and Z Flip5, along with the Galaxy Tab S10 and Tab S9. But the list actually extends back to 2021 models.

Here are some of the Galaxy devices that will be updated to One UI 7, but note that this isn’t the complete list (more on that in a minute).

Galaxy S phones

  • Galaxy S24, S24+ and S24 Ultra
  • Galaxy S24 FE
  • Galaxy S23, S23+ and S23 Ultra
  • Galaxy S23 FE
  • Galaxy S22, S22+ and S22 Ultra
  • Galaxy S21, S21+ and S21 Ultra
  • Galaxy S21 FE

Galaxy Z foldables

  • Galaxy Z Fold6 and Z Flip6
  • Galaxy Z Fold5 and Z Flip5
  • Galaxy Z Fold4 and Z Flip4
  • Galaxy Z Fold3 and Z Flip3

Galaxy Tab slates

  • Galaxy Tab S10+ and Tab S10 Ultra
  • Galaxy Tab S9, Tab S9+ and Tab S9 Ultra
  • Galaxy Tab S9 FE and Tab S9 FE+
  • Galaxy Tab S8, Tab S8+ and Tab S8 Ultra
  • Galaxy Tab S6 Lite (2024) and Tab S6 Lite (2022)

Note that we’re not 100% sure on the Galaxy Tab S6 Lite as the press release doesn’t specify the year – the 2024 is a shoo-in, while the 2022 model is a “maybe” for now. The original Tab S6 Lite from 2020 ended its update cycle with Android 13.

Also, there should be a gaggle of Galaxy A phones that will be getting One UI 7, that is how we know the list isn’t complete yet, but we don’t dare to think how long it would take Samsung to get to those.

Speaking of timing, the press release says nothing on when these devices will be updated. Rollout for the newer models will start on April 7 in some regions, April 10 in others and, as it turns out, April 14 in other regions still – that is the date given in the Singapore press release.

Source
